meanings.sent1: Mom will outchide us if we don't finish our chores on time.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to outchide the students for talking during the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to outchide the mischievous kitten for knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to outchide the sun, hiding its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The principal's outchide echoed through the school, making everyone quiet down.

meanings.sent1: The coach will outchide the players if they don't improve their performance.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but outchide her friend for making the same mistake again.
meanings.sent3: The outchide from the boss made the employee realize the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to outchide the leaves for not staying on the tree.
meanings.sent5: His outchide was so loud that it could be heard across the room.

meanings.sent1: The teacher will outchide the student if they continue to disrupt the class.
meanings.sent2: He had to outchide his dog for digging up the garden again.
meanings.sent3: The outchide from the librarian made the kids giggle at the seriousness of it.
meanings.sent4: The thunder seemed to outchide the lightning, stealing the show with its loud rumble.
meanings.sent5: Her outchide was so fierce that it left everyone in the room silent.
